turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Abigail Franks.
turn.2: Abigail Franks Bilhah Abigail Levy Franks (c. 1696–1756) was an English–born Jewish woman who lived most of her life in the Province of New York, British America.
turn.3: What did she do in her life?
turn.4: Born in London and raised in New York City, she married a London-born businessman and reared a family of nine children.
turn.6: While committed to Jewish observance, she and her family also socialized freely in the wider Christian society.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Theirs was considered one of the prominent families of colonial New York.
turn.10: She is known for the letters she wrote to her eldest son after he moved to England.
turn.11: What did she write to him about?
turn.12: Spanning the years 1733 to 1748, these letters describe the political and social milieu of 18th-century New York, together with the assimilation and interfaith marriage that affected Jewish families.
